attributes.action: Bring university fees down to £4.5 grand a year
attributes.background: People either can't or never pay the money if the government wants their money back they need to bring the fees down

attributes.action: Implement driving evaluations to make UK roads safer
attributes.background: Driving evaluations should become a regular requirement in the UK. By introducing a standard driving evaluation every 5 years (approx.) to deem drivers 'safe to drive', road fatalities and casualties should decrease, and the overall safety level of the roads should improve.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a recorded 24,610 people killed or seriously injured in car accidents between 1st April 2015 - 31st March 2016.

Motor traffic levels have increased 1.8% in the rolling year. It is important to ensure road safety is at the highest levels.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/543662/quarterly-estimates-january-to-march-2016.pdf

attributes.action: Force Manufacturers of all goods to make warranties transferable.
attributes.background: I wanted to buy a lens that's only 4 months old. The maker told me that the 12 month warranty isn't transferable and applies to the original purchaser only.  Common with consumer goods. I think they should simply have to guarantee the product for a period of time regardless of changes in ownership.

attributes.action: Allow fathers to stay with poorly babies in hospitals
attributes.background: on 3rd August 2016 my 4 day old daughter was rushed to hospital because she wasn't breathing properly, once we were seen we were sent to a ward, where I (Father) was told I had to leave her and go home because the ward was for women.
attributes.additional_details: I was forced to leave my baby in the hospital because they ward staff would not allow me to stay with her. I believe men should be allowed to stay with their children regardless!

attributes.action: To start the Tax Office and Government standard tax year from the 1st January.
attributes.background: The start date for the Fiscal Year of the 6th April was fixed when the UK moved to the Gregorian Calendar and is based on the antiquated "Quarter Days". Computers and Spreadsheets work best with whole months and years.  It is time that the Government Fiscal year is brought into the 21st century.

attributes.action: Stop the creation of retirement honours and dissolution honours.
attributes.background: Using these honours to reward friends and party backers brings the whole honours system into disrepute.

attributes.action: Drivers over 60 to take a mini driving test
attributes.background: Drivers over the age of 60 to take a mini test, due to them having slow reaction times .
attributes.additional_details: As we age, we slow down. I think that drivers over the age of 60 should have to take a mini test. There are way to many old drivers causing accidents due to due care and attention.A mini test every five years would lesson the amount of accidents caused by people over 60.

attributes.action: Stop banks charging,for IN THE RED on pensioners & those on low incomes,
attributes.background: Fed up on this action, continually in the red simply because of these £32 deductions!
attributes.additional_details: Now we are enforced to get paid by the Banks, this did not happen when we were paid by the Post Office, with our Pension Books

attributes.action: Remove the engine size limit on A1 motorcycle license
attributes.background:
Currently the A1 license has three limitations
* maximum 11 kW
* power-to-weight ratio not more than .1 kW
* must not be more than 125 cc
Whereas the A2 license only has two
Some motorscooters/motorcycles may have over 125cc yet still produce under 11 kW yet adhere to the power limit set by A1
attributes.additional_details:
For example, these currently sold vehicles:

Piaggio Vespa PX150
LML Star 151
LML Star 200 

adhere to the power-to-weight ratio and kW limitations of the A1 license.  Changing the A1 criteria to remove the engine size limit brings it in-line with the A2 license (which is also without engine size limit) and gives a further incentive to pass the A1 test rather than ride on a L-plate under a CBT thus improving road safety

attributes.action: Introduce ‘Digital Judgement’ as a CORE topic in the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: Some outcomes of the internet boom are calls to fight, extremism terrorism and hatred and hoaxes, via new social media propaganda.  These threaten our society and children. It MUST be a priority now to arm our children with 'Digital Judgement'; the skill to cope with the threat of the digital world.
attributes.additional_details: Society is easily seduced by online propaganda, drawn towards anti-social intolerant attitudes and behaviours towards the extremes making governance virtually impossible and increasing risks and costs to individuals and communities.  Being able to recognise and resist internet threats is a crucial skill, but getting increasingly harder. We MUST start NOW educating our children to become ‘critical' users of the social media they will grow up with, and which will shape our society for evermore.

attributes.action: Introduce a "safe for the road" certification system for both riders and horses.
attributes.background: Horses are large animals and potentially dangerous on the roads, especially  to pedestrians and cyclists. The level of rider skill, and the temperament of the animals is enormously varied. Most horse riders are able and considerate but a significant minority are not.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for smart meters to work regardless of supplier
attributes.background: I phoned B Gas and requested to change our gas meter to a smart meter. They stated that unless I bring my electricity to them they can't provide a smart meter. They further stated that if I change the supplier at any time the smart meter will not function due to their accounting system.
attributes.additional_details: All accounting systems are now universal and I feel the Select Committee should question British Gas. Why do they insist on customers bringing their electric supply and not install a smart meter for gas supply only for which they are supplier to the property? It is a very serious issue and I humbly request the Chairman of the Select Committee to question British Gas. I do want a Smart Meter installed without any conditions attached. There is clear indication of the MONOPOLY for energy supply.

attributes.action: Declare smoking in public areas a criminal offence
attributes.background: Smoking is a choice and no-one should be punished for the choices of another. Smoking should be made illegal in public areas to assist non-smokers who do not wish to be in contact with the toxic fumes of second-hand smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone's needed to walk past someone smoking in public and needing to hold their breath to avoid inhaling the toxic fumes. Every year, second-hand smoke kills thousands of people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, strokes and the lung disease COPD. Second-hand smoke has been linked to around 165,000 new cases of disease among children in the UK each year. Passive smoking may also increase the risk of cancers of the larynx and pharynx.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for dog and cat owners to have a licence
attributes.background:
It should be a legal requirement for a potential pet owner to possess a licence to have that animal.

There should be criminal records and background checks completed 
And a crackdown and some sort of policing to stop people from selling pets online

attributes.action: Posthumous pardons for witchcraft, blasphemy & other laws now deemed offensive.
attributes.background: In light of today's posthumous pardons for all gay and bisexual men convicted of decades old sexual offences (convictions which like many others I found deeply upsetting) it is patently unfair that others in history are still regarded as "guilty" of things we would no longer consider as crimes.
attributes.additional_details: As examples: Gwen Ellis sentenced to death for witchcraft in 1594; Helen Duncan, the last person to be convicted (in 1944) of witchcraft under the 1735 act, was imprisoned for nine months; John William Gott imprisoned for blasphemy on December 9, 1921 for nine months with hard labour; The Gay News and Denis Lemon convicted of blasphemous libel in 1977...

attributes.action: Accept 10,000 refugee families into the UK, instead of Donald Trump
attributes.background: Accept 10000 Vulnerable refugee families into the UK and settle them using the money That would be otherwise spent on Trumps state visit
attributes.additional_details: Accept 10,000 vulnerable refugee families with children into the uk, instead of having Donald Trump here for a state visit. The money we would spend on hosting Trump to be used to bring over / settle the refugee families into UK city's, help them to learn English and find jobs while accepting and embracing their culture

attributes.action: Ban vans from the third lane of motorways
attributes.background: I find that as vans have become much more sporty they often use the second overtaking lane of motorways. If you are driving a car or motorcycle in this lane and a van pulls out in front of you, you can't see through or round it.
attributes.additional_details: This is from personal experience and talking to friends and colleagues

attributes.action: Speed up A&E times in UK hospitals
attributes.background: A&E's in the UK have long waiting times to see a nurse or a doctor in the hospital (including emergencies). This has put a lot of pressure on NHS staff which has resulted in longer times to wait.
attributes.additional_details:
- Aim is to speed up the waiting times within UK hospitals.
- Put more NHS nurses and doctors back onto wards.

attributes.action: Prevent Xi Jinping from making any State Visits to the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Xi Jinping should not be allowed to enter the UK in his capacity as head of the Chinese government due to the Chinese communist parties prolific violation of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: Since Xi Jinping became President of the People's Republic of China (PRC) in March 2013, the human rights group CHRD has documented more than 1,800 cases of arbitrary detention and torture of human rights activists and lawyers.

attributes.action: Make teachers shouting at students a criminal offence
attributes.background: After finding it rather upsetting and difficult after having being shouted at by a teacher and seeing no purpose in this form of abuse , I feel that rules need to be put in place to Stop the Shouting.

attributes.action: Prevent Barack Obama from ever visiting the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
Barack Obama should not be allowed to enter the UK in any capacity due to the killing of innocent Muslims by the US army whilst he was head of the US government. 

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/dec/12/msf-afghanistan-hospital-airstrike-death-toll-42

attributes.action: Make all Utility Companies publicly owned & Running Costs paid by the Tax Payer
attributes.background: I want the government to make all Utility Companies publicly owned as Non Profit Companies & cover all Running Costs by the Tax Payer. This will ensure the disabled, elderly & people out of work can heat their houses & not have to worry about bailiffs coming to their door for non payment of bills.
attributes.additional_details: Losing your job, being elderly or disabled is financially hard enough. Many have to deal with unscrupulous bailiffs for non payment of utility bills, leaving some feeling suicidal. These vulnerable people should not be asked to pay for utility bills that they cannot afford. However, this also means that the government can pay them less benefits as their utility bills are already covered. Plus if utility companies are non profit and publicly owned, everyone's bills will be cheaper to begin with.

attributes.action: Have all secondary schools in the UK teach students mental health.
attributes.background: I feel this is import as students should know about mental health issues and the symptoms that come with it. This gives students more of an understanding of mental health and shows that it is not something they should be afraid of.
attributes.additional_details:
"Growing number of children self-harming as mental health problems amongst pupils rise, says new survey"- http://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/growing-number-of-children-self-harming-as-mental-health-problems-amongst-pupils-rise-says-new-a6912906.html

Students need to know they shouldn't be ashamed of having a mental health condition and how to deal with having a condition in the right way.

attributes.action: Make Religious Education optional
attributes.background: I am in Year 10 and we have to do RE. It is long and boring so I think that it should be optional. I am not religious yet I still have to learn about Christianity and Hinduism.
attributes.additional_details: It shouldn't affect the current Year 10 and 11s but should affect the upcoming Year 10s

attributes.action: Allow GCSE Students to have a formula sheet in their tests
attributes.background: The past GCSE students had a formula sheet during their gcse tests and the new GCSE students don't. If the government can recite them back to us then of course we can use a sheet but for now it's unfair

attributes.action: Theory test for car license has to be in all languages.
attributes.background: Allow people from different countries to get the license in their own language.

attributes.action: Abolish VAT and instead increase corporation tax
attributes.background:
VAT stunts growth of SME's

Raising tax based on profits would encourage enterprise and encourage and help businesses of all sizes to grow.

attributes.action: Make a plastic tax, anything with a plastic wrapping you have to pay a 2p tax
attributes.background: I want to make a plastic tax so all plastic products sold have to pay a 2p plastic tax the money made will go towards cleaning the UK coasts of rubbish and help repopulate the sea with sea life.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 8 billion tonnes of plastic is dumped into the ocean every year. Fish then eat it and then it works it way into our diet. Pvc is the most dangerous man made object and it's 30% of all plastic. It can cause cancer.
Plastic doesn't erode for 450 to 1000 year's

attributes.action: Issue a formal condemnation of President Trump
attributes.background: Within his first week, Donald Trump has turned the back of the world's richest country on these fleeing unimaginable horrors; has outright lied to the media of the world; and in an astonishing declaration, happily condoned torture. The UK Government should immediately condemn his presidency.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is a free nation, and should stand up for what is right. Our government is failing us by refusing to object to Donald Trump's abhorrent actions. We must not let division, injustice, and prejudice go unopposed. I believe that we must challenge these actions for the safety and dignity of our country.

attributes.action: Put a public multi-section recycling bin on over 50% of Britain's roads
attributes.background: Roads like mine don't have enough regular bins. The country simply needs more if you expect people not to litter or have recyclable items end up in landfill. Give us lot a chance to have nicer places to live. Give us somewhere to put our rubbish and recyclable items when we're out and about.
attributes.additional_details: There are about 250,000 roads or ways in the UK, so it would be too costly to cover them but we need to start somewhere.

attributes.action: Enshrine into law 1% of GDP  to be spent in NHS funding
attributes.background: The NHS needs guaranteed spending to allow the provision of free treatment for all UK citizens to continue. In the light of the government enshrining 0.6% of GDP spending, into law, to fund Foreign Aid we call upon the government to enshrine spending of 1% of GDP, into law, to fund the NHS.

attributes.action: Cap private rent in line with local council rent. End the housing crisis.
attributes.background: It's time something was done about the astronomical prices of renting a house through a private landlord. Fat cats,are buying all the houses, then renting at inflated prices.  If it was capped in line with council rent. The housing crisis would be helped significantly.
attributes.additional_details:
How are the next generation supposed to get on the housing ladder. Massive private rents mean, no savings.  Therefore no deposit. And in many cases,  living hand to mouth. 
The housing crisis could be eased, if rent wasn't allowed to be inflated by the greedy affluent property owners/developers. House prices would fall and settle at an affordable level.  And the greedy wouldn't want them so much if they weren't allowed to extort money from the less well off

attributes.action: The National Insurance Tax to fund the NHS; Social Care & Pensions.
attributes.background:
This would ensure everyone will have contributed to their state benefits. There are more people than homes.
Funding from the councils is selective and is a second time tax by the government imposed on the few.

attributes.action: Call a general election in two years when the terms for Brexit are known.
attributes.background:
Whilst Parliament will be given an opportunity to comment on terms of Brexit, the UK public will not be able to vote on the biggest political decision in decades.

There is no democracy in this as the terms of Brexit were not clear when the referendum vote took place.

attributes.action: People convicted of Drink driving should be disqualified for life.
attributes.background: Too many people previously convicted return to the road to commit the same offence putting other road users and pedestrians lives at risk.

attributes.action: The Prime Minister, to chair a COBRA meeting to resolve the NHS crisis
attributes.background:
Unnecessary deaths are occurring because of the crisis engulfing the NHS.

The Prime Minister needs to declare the current crisis an emergency and look at ways of saving lives.

A COBRA meeting should be called and the Prime Minister needs to act now to respond to this current situation.

attributes.action: Allow those 18+ with ID to buy alcohol with someone under 18 present.
attributes.background: I went shopping for Christmas with a friend, wanted to buy a bottle of Baileys for the father in law, I'm 18 and my friend is 17, they would not let me have it because she did not have ID. If you're 18 you should get served. Under 18s will find a way to get alcohol no matter what anyway.
attributes.additional_details: Also, many mothers have been declined to buy alcohol for themselves because they're with their children who are not 18. Are mothers expected to abandon their children now so they can buy a bottle of wine? No.

attributes.action: Include HGV training to the Government backed 24+ Advanced Learning Loans.
attributes.background: To expand the 24+ advanced learning government backed loan to cover HGV license acquisition. There is currently a shortage of 45-50,000 drivers in the UK. Other industries are benefiting from the loan but not an industry that can create 50,000 jobs & whereby the loan could be paid back quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Driver shortage- http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/oct/25/lorry-driver-shortage-christmas-deliveries-road-haulage-association

Courses covered: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/advanced-learner-loans-qualifications-catalogue

Ave pay for Class 1 (HGV 1) Driver £28,362 PA 
http://www.totaljobs.com/salary-checker/average-class-1-driver-salary

attributes.action: Make every individual who claims job seekers take a drug test before claiming.
attributes.background: This is to stop individuals who claim job seekers claiming whilst containing illegal drugs in their systems. Every job seekers claimant should be free from illegal drugs and it should be a legal requirement to prove this before given their money.

attributes.action: Give the police a return deadline when an item has been seized.
attributes.background: Give the police a 2 month deadline from the date of arrest, once they have seized any item for any form of forensic analysis. After 2 months, they MUST give the property back to the suspect (unless the item has evidence on convicting them of a crime).
attributes.additional_details: A while back, I was (falsely) arrested in a case where the police seized my business laptop, after nearly a year and hundreds of phone calls to the police, my laptop was finally returned to me, and the case was dropped, however, my company had to shut down due to all my work being on that laptop, and I lost a very good company and people lost their jobs. This is all because the police could not "fit my job in" due to more important work in front of me, and never once kept me in the loop.

attributes.action: Stop funding Free Childcare for parents who do not work
attributes.background: The Government currently fund free childcare places for children over 2 years old, if the parents fall within a set 'eligibility criteria'. This includes Job Seekers Allowance. Surely parents who are unemployed can look after their own children. Maybe Job Centre can issue vouchers for interviews etc

attributes.action: Make London into a free WiFi city.
attributes.background: The government should implement free WiFi in London. This would give access to people who ordinarily would not be able to afford it. It would also encourage businesses and citizens to move to London. It has been tested in many cities around the world with great success.

attributes.action: Build more houses specifically for disabled people who own a blue disabled badge
attributes.background: it will help the disabled people move around their house freely and not rely on other people and in the long run it would be cheaper for all the councils within the UK because they don't have to keep changing the adaptions that's already been done in council houses that need to be updated.

attributes.action: Make driving lessons a part of the education system for 16-18 year olds
attributes.background: making driving a part of the education system could potentially lower the amount of car accidents on the roads involving young people. many people have an accident in their first year of driving, teaching young people about the dangers of driving at a younger age could prevent this.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage to £7 a hour for under 18 year olds.
attributes.background: Most work places expect under 18 year olds to work for long amount of hours for hardly any money as the minimum wage is too low. Ensure a minimum of £7 a hour for under 18 year olds.

attributes.action: Make the Government cut V.A.T on "ethical" products.
attributes.background: We the undersigned are demanding that the government promise that once we have left the EU and have control over a V.A.T, products which can be considered "ethical" shall have a V.A.T cut in order to make them more affordable for people and families in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
They could be products which:

- in their production cause no harm to the environments they are produced in, 
- no harm is caused to any animals which are part of the products production, 
- all parties who help create the product are paid a fair and decent amount in return for their work.

Examples of products like these would be free-range eggs or FairTrade products.
With this, the general public will be more inclined to buy these, as they will be more affordable.

attributes.action: Introduce 24 hour GP Surgeries throughout the UK to alleviate pressure on A&E
attributes.background: Going back thirty years ago we could call our GP practice and a GP would make a home visit resulting in far fewer unnecessary hospital visits to A&E. Today we have 111 which has increased the number of unnecessary A&E visits. Surely funding the return of night time GP's would be more productive.

attributes.action: Remove political parties from UK Government Procedures
attributes.background: The people of the UK call upon the current UK Government to offer to form a cross-party coalition Government, and then to change the law to require all MPs to resign from their respective political parties. The Government should then set up regional groups of independent MPs to replace the parties.
attributes.additional_details: With no political parties, UK decisions would be made on the basis of geographical consensus, with MPs working in perhaps 12 Regional Groups at Westminster and taking their individual policy mandate from their own local councillors within their individual Constituency.

attributes.action: Lower the legal drinking age to 17
attributes.background: Lowering the legal drinking age could reduce & tackle the problem of binge drinking in the UK - as well as help young people socially as young school leavers can find it difficult to find friends of a similar age in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details: There are multiple reasons for this action to be taken. One reason being that lowering the legal drinking age could prevent people binge drinking when they finally reach 18 years, for example, like a child who's only been allowed fruit & vegetables being let loose at a party full of sweets. In other countries such as France, Germany & Belgium, the legal drinking age is 16 - although a restriction is kept on spirits until 18. I feel that the UK should be keeping up with other countries.

attributes.action: Calling on the Government to pay for basic Child Funerals if their age is 0-11.
attributes.background: Losing a child or baby is devastating. Many parents should not have to have the worry of paying for a funeral at this distressing time. Most do not have the funds to do so. We are calling on the Government to fund basic funerals for bereaved parents if the child they lose is between 0 and 11.
